name: The Four Seasons Island Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went on the off season and were treated like royalty. We nearly had the run of the place to ourselves. The food in the restaurant was just spectacular and even though we were only going to eat "fancy" one night - we just had to eat there again the next evening. The owner/manager was on site and shook our hands. They upgraded us to a hot tub room no charge and our suite had a lovely full kitchen. Wonderful scenery surrounding - visited the local waterfalls.
reviews.title: Perfect get-away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time at the Four Seasons and we will be back again. This is a first class resort. The rooms are very large and designed well ( just get a room with a balcony) the lounge on the lower level is cozy and the food was excellent. The only reason I gave this a 4 rating is we waited about 50 minutes to get our steaks after our salad. The waitress apologized for the long wait and did offer us a free drink, but we just wanted to get our food. With that being said, the prime rib I had was one of the best I've ever had. My wife loved her steak as well. Overall the place is great for a special weekend getaway.
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Couldn't have had a better stay! Great time golfing and swimming in the saltwater pool. Our son loved it! Excellent dinner, cocktails in the lounge followed by karaoke. Great to meet Lloyd and Michelle. Thanks for a great mini-cation!
reviews.title: What a getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We liked the size of the rooms, the service, the continental breakfast, the fact there is something for everyone to do.
reviews.title: FIRST CLASS OPERATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We celebrated our 50th wedding anniversary at the Four Seasons on June 8th with our 4 children, their spouses and 7 grandchildren. It couldn't have been a nicer experience. The service was great, we loved the size of the rooms and there is something for everyone to do. What a beautiful place hidden in the woods. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: FIRST CLASS OPERATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a halfway stop on our way to Mackinac Island and all the surrounding cities referenced the Four Seasons, which had many more "stars." It was Memorial Day weekend with a 2-night minimum, so we added a day to our trip. Steve, the front desk manager, was able to put us in a regular room, which was awesome with coffee on the balcony overlooking the bridge and golf course (sunny side, which felt good on a semi-chilly morning.). We went on to our destination, where we had planned to stay 4 nights. After one day seeing the island (which was fun, but city accommodations not) we decided to return to the Four Seasons--we had told Steve we'd be back, but he probably hadn't expected us that soon! Got our same room and it was a perfect end to our trip. Also, I wanted to have the Bazinga Shrimp a couple of more times! All meals are first class and you can go casual. Witnessed an emergency ambulance situation at the front desk and Lloyd, Michelle and staff all pitched in like the family they are. The gal involved was able to mention that she had promised us a tour of one of the luxury suites as she was being wheeled out--how dedicated is that?? Got our tour and we will definitely be staying there soon but I'm not giving up the room number!! To top it all off, the prices are very reasonable, even for a holiday weekend.
reviews.title: A Truly Special Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sorry so long, but we think so highly of this place, we brought back brochures and have told our friends we want to go back with them, adjoining rooms, etc. Thanks everyone!! Lynn & Steve
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations in every area!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had an AMAZING time!!!!! The service was absolutely spectacular in all areas…front desk, wait staff, bartenders, concierge, everything!! We are very impressed and we have both built our careers around taking care of the customers. The food was outstanding. Your kitchen staff is extremely talented and the owners should be very proud.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service and Food!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I and another couple recently spent a week-end on the island. The resort is beautiful.....clean rooms, quiet, surrounded by water and a golf course, pool, spa, fine dinning, great lounge with live entertainment. We went for some outdoor activity and hiked to many of the waterfalls in the area......great experience. We had a picnic lunch in front of one of the falls doesn't get much better. Then back to the resort for a relaxing whirlpool. Ended the day with dinner at the resort and yes we would highly recommend the stuffed mushrooms also.....prime rib was another winner. We had a great time!!
reviews.title: Tucked away in Northern Wisconsin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed on the island a few times, most recent 5/3-5/6. If you haven't been there you need to , Lloyd & Michelle are wonderful host's and if you miss the hospitality it means you never left your room. Live music was phenomenal Fri and Sat. Very fine dinning with many options ( I personally would like to recommend the stuff mushrooms as a appetizer). This is a great place tucked away in the northwoods , you wont hear horns or car engines....you drive across a wooden platform bridge to get on the island....bring a fishing pole, golf clubs and a camera to capture the beauty.....it has something for everyone.
reviews.title: Fantatsic getaway AAA+++

reviews.title: Clean, Friendly, Impressive Bargain, would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I wanted my family or four to get away for a night to celebrate the end of another school year and the start of a great summer. The Four Seasons was featured on groupon so I decided to purchase a night. We usually go to Lake Geneva and enjoy ourselves, but now I think we will head north instead of south. The Four Seasons is a wonderful resort. We brought our bikes and thought it was great to be able to ride our bikes into Michigan. The front desk staff was very helpful. They even drew us a map to help us get to Morgan Park to see the waterfalls. The room was lovely with a full kitchen and fridge. I did notice that there were very few dishes so if we had actually used the kitchen and cooked a meal it might have been an issue, but we did not. The hot tub was under construction while we were there, but we enjoyed the pool. We rented a canoe and paddled around the island which was very fun. We will return for sure. We all had a great time. We have a four wheeler and next time we will bring it with as the trails are right on the other side of the bridge. What a wonderful scenic relaxing resort. Thank you for a great kick off to our summer.
reviews.title: Great Northwoods find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited the Resort for the first time in early June for a get away weekend and WOW - It is GORGEOUS. I had heard good things about the place from friends and the Trip Advisor reviews had been great but I was still surprised at the level of service and natural beauty of the Resort. We don't play golf but after seeing the course even my husband wants to learn how to play! Both dinners at the Steakhouse were just amazing. It was so nice to sit in the glass enclosed porch and look out at the golf course. The staff is top notch and attentive to our every need. The food was perfection. The chef is sooo talented - it has been a long time since I have had food this delicious and it was so much more than just the usual selections of steaks and shrimp. Our room was a hot tub suite and was spotless and very comfortable with a kitchen and living area and a walk out patio overlooking the golf course. The pool was wonderful. so often hotel pools are closed in and gloomy but this huge pool area was brightly lit with large windows with a patio with wicker chairs and chaises just outside the door. We did spend both nights after dinner in the Lounge and the entertainment and ambiance was perfect - lots of fun. The grounds were totally immaculate, neatly trimmed and cared for. Even the Pro Shop was lovely with a great selection of clothing and very friendly and helpful manager. but of all the staff we encountered - and they were all outstanding - our favorite was Tyler. He is certainly a credit to the Resort and goes way beyond what is needed for everything. I have learned that you can tell a lot about a hotel or resort by looking at the staff. When it is obvious that they love their job then you know this is a place you will enjoy. The location in the river was so quiet and restful and I LOVE the old railroad bridge you cross to enter the grounds. This is the perfect place to come for a getaway, a golf outing or fishing the river - whatever you want. We did get to see some of the business facilities and they are just like the rest of the resort - top notch and suitable for just about any corporate event. I still can't believe this place is here and that it has taken me this long to discover it! We are looking forward to another visit as soon as we can get away. Just love it.....
reviews.title: Outstanding Five Star Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were guests at this hotel June 7 and 8. We usually get away on weekends in Lake geneva, which is not as far , however this was worth the distance. The staff is first rate, and the room was immaculate. Jennifer (hostess at the resturaunt) , is a very elegant and classy person. Thank you for a memorable stay. Definately will visit again.
reviews.title: immaculate property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a note and to let the staff and owners of this fine resort just know how enjoyable our two day stay was !
reviews.title: Hidden Gem !

description: Originally opened in 1905 by the Wisconsin and Michigan Railroad and located just 90 miles from Green Bay, WI and 28 miles from Iron Mountain, Michigan this 55 all suite hotel is located on the majestic Miscauno Island tucked into the north woods of Wisconsin. The magnificent historical facade continues to impress guests as they first peer up at the grand entry when traveling across the original one lane, one hundred year old, steel constructed bridge. Guests enjoy modern amenities while the resort’s original architecture, charm and relaxing ambiance have been tastefully preserved.Surrounded by a challenging 9 hole, par 34 golf course bordered by the Menominee River, the island offers something for everyone. Remember an era of travel with our vintage vehicles located in the steakhouse & lounge’s lobby. Relax and rejuvenate with a visit to the spa, indoor heated swimming pool, whirlpool and sauna. Looking for something a little faster paced? The island has numerous activities to select from and easy access to snowmobile, 4-wheeling, cross country ski trails as well as an ice rink, tennis court, basketball, sand volleyball, fishing, boating and much more. Book A Room!The Four Seasons Island Resort offers a variety flexible meeting and banquet spaces. Perfect for social events such as weddings and receptions or executive meetings of 20 as well as gatherings for 400. The Four Seasons Island Resort will assist you in planning the perfect social event.
